org.bsc.bean
Class AggregateBeanManager<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.bsc.bean.AggregateBeanManager<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
BeanManager<T>
public class AggregateBeanManager<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements BeanManager<T>

manage bean persistence operation on DB using BeanInfo and PropertyDescriptorField extention and support operations create, store and remove on the bean mapped on multiple table. 

Connection conn =  open connection ... 

MyBean bean = new MyBean();

 set properties of bean 

BeanManagerBase beanManager = new BeanManagerBase(MyBean.class);

//CREATE(INSERT) BEAN ON DB
beanManager.create( conn, bean );

//STORE(UPDATE) BEAN ON DB
beanManager.store( conn, bean );

//REMOVE (DELETE) BEAN ON DB
beanManager.remove( conn, id value );

//FIND (SELECT) BEAN BY ID ON DB

MyBean bean  = (MyBean)beanManager.findById( conn, id value );

//FIND (SELECT) BEAN(S) BY CONDITION ON DB

java.util.Enumeration e = beanManager.find( conn,
        "property name like ?",
        new Object[] { "FOR%" } );

while( e.hasMoreElements() ) {
      bean = (MyBean)e.nextElement();
}

conn.close();

See Also:
bsc.bean.PropertyDescriptorField, BeanDescriptor

 T findById(java.sql.Connection conn, java.lang.Object... id)
          select bean from db using an primary key value Note: if you have a composite key must pass into id parameter a Object array that contains the PK values Ex.: // SINGLE KEY (string) String id = "xxxxx"; MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id ); // MULTIPLE KEY (string,integer) String id[] = {"xxxxx", new Integer(1) }; MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );

store

public int store(java.sql.Connection conn,
                 T bean,
                 StoreConstraints constraints,
                 java.lang.String... properties)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
update bean into db having the possibility of include/exclude properties into update command 
   Ex.:

    String props[] = { "prop1",  "prop2", ... };

    int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, props, true ); // include

    OR

    int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, props, false ); // exclude

Specified by:
store in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
bean - object to update into db
properties - properties to include/exclude to update
constraints - allow to include or exclude properties from update
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

findById

public T findById(java.sql.Connection conn,
                  java.lang.Object... id)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
select bean from db using an primary key value Note: if you have a composite key must pass into id parameter a Object array that contains the PK values 
    Ex.:
// SINGLE KEY (string)
    String id = "xxxxx";
    MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );
// MULTIPLE KEY (string,integer)
    String id[] = {"xxxxx", new Integer(1) };
    MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );

Specified by:
findById in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
id - primary key value
Returns:
bean | null
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

find

public java.util.Collection<T> find(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                    java.util.Collection<T> result,
                                    java.lang.String where,
                                    java.lang.Object... values)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
 select beans from db using a where condition and cache the result into collection

 NB
 can close the connection before you use the collection

Specified by:
find in interface BeanManager<T>
Parameters:
conn - database connection
result - instance of collection that will contains all the instance of beans
where - condition formatted like PreparedStatement
values - Object array contains a parameters value specified into where condition
create an entry for each ? into where condition
Returns:
collection that contains all the instance of beans ( same of result parameter )
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
java.sql.PreparedStetement
